item.title: Overview
item.description:
We use a custom Microsoft Access database to manage the registered kids and all of their associated info. This database is also the means by which we track the breakdown of our various tribes.



Since registration is not directly linked to this database, the information must be semi-manually imported once initial registration closes. To do this, export the registration form data from the registration platform (Clover, Google Forms, etc.). The data will either be output as a .csv (Comma Separated Values) file. Open this file in Microsoft Excel and save it as a .xlsx (Microsoft Excel Workbook) file for ease of use.
Go through the two address columns and merge any entries in "Address Line 2" with the respective entries in "Address Line 1."
Remove the following unnecessary columns and all their content:

Address Line 2
Country
Food Allergies (not the column with the actual allergies, just the column that lists the yes or no answers).
Other Allergies/Medical Needs
Other Allergies/Medical Needs - Value
Created At
Reverse the order of the first two columns so that the "Last Name" column becomes Column A and the "First Name" column becomes Column B.
The first row in the spreadsheet contains the column header information and must match the order and naming scheme found in the "Header Template.xlsx" spreadsheet. You can copy the data from that file and replace the contents of this first row for convenience. Verify that everything matches and that the headers line up with the appropriate columns.

item.title: Timeline
item.description:
Coordinate with media team to show last year's slideshow.
Announce that Cow Creeker Registration opens on Monday.
Double-check codes on website.


Update website to show that Cow Creek Registration is now open.





Announce that Postcard Registration opens on Monday.
Late Sunday night (right before going to bed), update codes on registration form to accept the postcard code in addition to the Cow Creek code.


Update website to show that Postcard Registration is now open.





Announce that General Registration opens on Monday.
Late Sunday night (right before going to bed), remove access code on registration form. Preview the form and make sure that all sections appear and that no error messages associated with the code appear.


Update website to show that General Registration is now open.




If registration hasn't already filled up, close it and transition to a waiting list.
Import registration data into the access database. (See Access Database for info.)







Take tribe pictures
Make postcards
